page.title: 20 Modern Bayham Abbey
page.content:
In the 1870's a magnificent{mansion was built on the south facing slopes, overlooking the monastery ruins. Confusingly, it was also named{Bayham {Abbey.}The outbuildings to the rear included its own fire station, but the appliance was only called out once and the fire was out before it arrived. At this present time the mansion has been converted into several private flats and the outbuildings into extremely attractive cottages. The views across the lake to the ruins are idyllic. The{River Teise}flows into the 16 acres of{Bayham Lake.}A series of waterfalls and pools have enhanced the natural attraction for{fly fishermen.} The{trout}to be caught from boats or the bank average over a kilogram.
By the pupils and staff of {LAMBERHURST C.E. PRIMARY SCHOOL}
